metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1000111 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Twisted before 16.3.1 does not attempt to address RFC 3875 section 4.1.18 namespace conflicts and therefore does not protect CGI applications from the presence of untrusted client data in the HTTP_PROXY environment variable, which might allow remote attackers to redirect a CGI application's outbound HTTP traffic to an arbitrary proxy server via a crafted Proxy header in an HTTP request, aka an "httpoxy" issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1000111` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-twisted - 17.9.0-1
python-twisted-bin - 17.9.0-1
python-twisted-core - 17.9.0-1
python-twisted-mail - 17.9.0-1
python-twisted-names - 17.9.0-1
python-twisted-news - 17.9.0-1
python-twisted-runner - 17.9.0-1
python-twisted-web - 17.9.0-1
python-twisted-words - 17.9.0-1
python3-twisted - 17.9.0-1
python3-twisted-bin - 17.9.0-1
No subscription required

python-twisted-conch - 17.9.0-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> code is not present in precise/esm

criterions.comment: twisted package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '17.9.0-1').
